article.headline: Manhattan 57, Fairfield 54
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Antoine Pearson scored 14 points Friday night in leading Manhattan to a 57-54 victory over Fairfield in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener for both teams. Devon Austin and Patrick Bouli each had 13 points for the Jaspers (3-5, 1-0), who snapped a four-game losing streak. Jonathan Han led Fairfield (2-10, 0-1) with 13 points. The Stags shot 27.7 percent from the floor in losing their third straight. Pearson hit two free throws with 11 minutes left in the game, giving the Jaspers their first lead at 36-34. Fairfield took a 44-42 lead on two foul shots by Michael Van Schaick with 5:37 remaining, but the Jaspers used an 8-2 burst over the next four minutes to gain control. The teams combined for 52 fouls. Van Schaick and Herbie Allen each scored 10 points for Fairfield.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
